meanings.definition: A type of paperboard used for making boxes.
meanings.sent1: The boxboard was sturdy and perfect for packaging fragile items.
meanings.sent2: The factory ordered a shipment of boxboard to create new boxes for shipping products.
meanings.sent3: When the cat jumped into the boxboard, it made a funny crinkling sound.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity soared as she transformed the plain boxboard into a colorful castle for her toys.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh boxboard filled the room, reminding him of the excitement of receiving a new package.

meanings.definition: The material used to make boxes.
meanings.sent1: The boxboard was stacked neatly in the corner, ready to be crafted into boxes.
meanings.sent2: The company sourced high-quality boxboard to ensure durable packaging for their products.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally tripped over a roll of boxboard, causing a comical domino effect.
meanings.sent4: His ideas flowed like a river as he brainstormed innovative ways to utilize the boxboard.
meanings.sent5: The boxboard gleamed under the sunlight, promising protection for the items inside.

meanings.sent1: The boxboard was recycled to create eco-friendly packaging solutions.
meanings.sent2: The delivery truck was filled with stacks of boxboard ready to be used for shipping.
meanings.sent3: The boxboard suddenly collapsed, causing a chain reaction of boxes tumbling down.
meanings.sent4: Her heart sank as she realized the boxboard had absorbed water, ruining the packaging.
meanings.sent5: The boxboard crinkled loudly as she folded it, signaling the start of the packaging process.
